result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kurt D Neuman was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond on file to be applied. Costs paid in full.
With Huber and Good Time Credit. Court does not object to jail transfer.
Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt D Neuman

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned)-tpg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 10:25 am case called. Defendant Kurt D Neuman in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Anderson makes statement regarding agreement and states on record.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 and DRI-15TR18. No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 6 months WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 3 days served. To begin forthwith. Court does not object to jail transfer. $2,500.00 fine inclusive of costs and blood draw fee. Bond to be applied-costs paid in full. 34 month DL revocation, 34 mo IID beginning today. OWI Assessment. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2015 at 10:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Schmidt states his client will accept the offer of the State. Plea and sentencing to be set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on February 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 1:37 PM: Defendant Kurt D Neuman in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves Amended Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court addresses waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  ARGN to proceed today.  INFO stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  Atty Schmidt argues as to current bond conditions, specifically no driving prohibition.  ADA defers to the Court as to the no driving prohibition.  The Court:  Court permits amendment of the bond - condition amended to  no operation of any motor vehicles without a valid license.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:32 PM: Defendant Kurt D Neuman in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court concerned over the lack of counsel today.  Def is in the process of obtaining his own counsel - has talked with Atty Eric Scheets, no formal retainer yet.  Def has been advised by counsel to waive time limits today.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing today.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court will proceed with the understanding that Atty Sheets will be retained.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on December 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:05 p.m. Defendant Kurt D Neuman in court, in custody, appears via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant wishes to have counsel and will privately retain an attorney. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $2500 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
